questions.question: What's your ideal first day in a new country?

options.text: Wake up early, hike to a hidden spot
Find a street food vendor and chat with locals
Take a guided tour through the old town and museums
Check into a luxury stay, order room service

questions.question: Which of these sounds most like your travel vibe?

options.text: One-way ticket. No plan. Let's go.
I'm going to learn this language while I'm there
I'm here to rest, reset, and journal
I'll be working remote, but catching sunsets too
Always bring a camera for moments & ruins
Save every spot to Google Maps before landing
Drop into a café and see who I meet
Book a facial or massage the first night

questions.question: What's your favorite type of trip?

options.text: Volunteering or building something that lasts
A guided group tour across Europe
Living out of a backpack, country-hopping
A retreat where I can fully unplug
Soft jazz and a glass of wine
Old-school reggae and backpacker vibes
Cinematic film scores
Lo-fi hip hop while coding in a hostel
Crystals, essential oils, journal
Camera, walking shoes, old maps
Power bank, laptop, multiple SIM cards
Sketchbook and paint, work gloves

questions.question: Which of these would you rather do on vacation?

options.text: Plan a surprise for locals or fellow travelers
Host a language exchange or join one
Spend the day getting pampered at a spa
Go completely off-grid for a while

questions.question: Pick a caption for your next travel photo:

options.text: "Got lost and found everything."
"Booked this on points and vibes."
"Recharging in a place that heals."
"Woke up in a castle today. Casual."

questions.question: Your ideal travel group would be:

options.text: Just me and my journal
A small group of curious strangers
A co-working tribe of digital nomads
A volunteering crew building something meaningful

questions.question: You're most likely to post a story about:

options.text: That hole-in-the-wall café no one knows
An ancient ritual or cultural festival
A luxury suite overlooking the ocean
A mountain sunrise after a tough climb
Find your purpose or deepen your practice
Chase adrenaline and motion
Live better, softer, and slower
Connect, help, and contribute

questions.question: If you had one free month, you'd:

options.text: Wander alone through ancient cities
Disguise yourself and live like a local
Work on a creative or community project abroad
Go somewhere with no cell signal
